name: acoustically
content:
acoustically adverb
(SOUND / HEARING)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that relates to sound or hearing: The new building was acoustically designed for album recordings. Words heard in isolation are acoustically different from the same words in running speech.
More examplesFewer examplesThe modem would send and receive tones acoustically.Each of the alcoves in the recording studio are acoustically separate.Acoustically speaking, the most striking sound coming from the Hall these days is silence.

acoustically adverb
(NOT ELECTRIC)
on a musical instrument that is not made louder by electrical equipment: He plays with passion, whether on electric guitar or acoustically. Tonight he will take the stage alone, performing acoustically.
More examplesFewer examplesI like doing songs acoustically.His band was formed years before the electronic era, and his greatest hits were acoustically recorded.The silence of a church may suit musicians playing acoustically.
